MARKETING to market a product or a service using a new or different method, or to market it to a different group of consumers: Students were given a pretend $5 million budget and the directive to remarket New Orleans as a top destination to the world.
FINANCE to sell shares, bonds, etc. that have been made available by other borrowers: The bank is expected to provide a letter of credit so the Convention Center Authority can remarket $64 million in public bonds to build the center. remarketing noun [ S or U ]
This issue is a remarketing of previously issued bonds.
